text:
Hi, the following situation:
- two website pages A and B, where B is a clone of A
- A is based on template TA and B on TB which is a clone of template TA
- TA conains a module with a HubSpot form
- TB contains a module with a custom form
- A and B pages have the exact same domain stylesheets associated in Settings -> Advanced section
- TA and TB also have the exact same stylesheets associated in design manager

Now: when I check the source code page A only has a CSS file called */combines-css-$hash.css where B has the correct stylsheets originally associated and does not have the combinde-css file….

This leads to the custom form not to display correctly, a lot of CSS is missing entirely (it does not seem to be overwritten but actually missing).

Any suggestions?
Hey Guys, I have a question about the initial HubSpot setup for a new clients blog (the first free setup.) Will HubSpot setup based on a mockup or does the site have to be live?
from my experience it's always been a migration, not a full first-time build. So yes, the site would need to be available online.

Asked this yesterday, hoping someone has an answer — Setting up meetings for a client.  The image for meetings is using my name as alt text.  Any way for me to set up meetings image and use the image title rather than who created the meeting?
i mean, i want to get my name out there…but probably in a different way
maybe a bigger image would help
unless it's recently changed... the website needs to be live.
has anyone created or know of a good HubSpot snippet library?
other than on <http://designer.HubSpot.com|designer.HubSpot.com>
I know there is a code gallery in the works for stuff like this but as far as an already existing one, none that I know of. Some may have git repo's with code but I dont know of any off hand
ok.  didnt think so
I am going to start stealing snippets from here and start building something.
“steal”
<https://codepen.io/billyoncetoldme/pen/rQOxmr>
will move that to a git repo at somepoint and let others add
We were planning on working on some open source documentation in <https://github.com/HubSpot/jinjava> we could eventually move some of these snippets over there

The :sprocket: HubSpot developer "{{ code }} Gallery" will likely be helpful.
> - The Developer {{ code }} Gallery is a showcase of the amazing open source projects our developer community is working on.
> - Think of this as HubSpot's version of CodePen, but with all files hosted in GitHub.
We're working hard to have a beta in early-Q1 :crossed_fingers:
What kind of validation are you looking for? Every upload is checked for viruses.
awesome
If you have specific features (based on what you've found helpful elsewhere) you'd love to see in the {{ code }} Gallery, please let me know.
My QA team always flags forms in HubSpot. As long as it is being checked upstream, i am fine.
will do
Thanks guys!

*Issue with preview of changes before publishing*: when I have a module inside a drag-and-drop template in the design manager an d I make changes to the module, I wont be able to preview the changes of the module inside of the template-preview unless I publish the changes done to the module…. can you confirm this  behaviour?

Question: If I add an IP Address to the "Exclude Traffic" area, will this reflect in my dashboard data or is this just forward moving like in GA (meaning historical data will not be updated/reflected)

I'm having a bit of trouble managing a webinars page for a global business where they want to show the local time for the visitors location. Seems like daylight savings times are constantly messing this up, anyone have a high level approach they could share that works for them?
